home · research · notes & code

Hello! I’m Shashank and I am a third-year PhD student in the Applied Mathematics, Applied Statistics and Scientific Computation program at the University of Maryland, College Park. I am jointly advised by Dr. Wojciech Czaja and Dr. Maria Cameron. I am interested in applied harmonic analysis, machine learning, and spectral graph theory. Before Maryland, I graduated from Amherst College with a degree in mathematics.

This semester I am co-organizing the ML for Rare Events RIT. Please contact Dr. Maria Cameron in case you need to register for credit!

Find my latest CV or email me at ssule25[at]umd[dot]edu.
